sentences.sContent: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.sContent_eng: Their missiles are viewed as a defensive and deterrent force.
sentences.sCn: 他们的导弹被视为一种防卫和威慑力量。

sentences.sContent: However, this is a new age and those attacks will be stopped by a small nukeand therefore, it is not a deterrent anymore.
sentences.sContent_eng: However, this is a new age and those attacks will be stopped by a small nukeand therefore, it is not a deterrent anymore.
sentences.sCn: 然而，如今是新的时代，这样的攻击只要一枚核弹就完了，因此，这种战术已经不再是威慑。

sentences.sContent: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.sContent_eng: Scientists do not know why this is the case but believe it could be an evolutionary throwback to less sophisticated times when crying acted as a deterrent to amorous males at times of turmoil.
sentences.sCn: 科学家们目前尚不明确为什么会这样，但是他们认为这可能是一种进化返祖现象，因为在蛮荒时代，哭泣在骚乱时是对发情男性的一种威慑。

synos.tran: 威慑；妨碍物；挽留的事物

remMethod.val: 来自deter(v. 威慑， 吓住)

words.tran: 威慑；妨碍物；挽留的事物
